item.title: Configure Ssh Alias
item.description: Tutorial to connect your server with ssh alias ssh-keygen Create an ssh private/public keypair. I named my key personal. Do replace yours. For passwordless experience, let passphrase empty. cd $HOME/.ssh ssh-keygen -t rsa Copy public key to server My server is 192.168.1.111. Do replace with yours. 2.1. Manually copy Print and copy your public key cat ~/.ssh/personal.pub On your server, pass the public key to the end of $HOME/.ssh/authorized_keys 2.2. Use ssh-copy-id
